Author: Enkh D#1827
Content: Will stable coins be backed by kmd tokens or real fiat? Also, will oracle solution be blovkchain agnostic or only applicable to komodo like coins?

Author: —ï‚ÑìŒπ–º#1031
Content: I do not know those answers sorry, hopefully someone else can help!

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: pegged coins are backed by crypto, the tech is agnostic to which coin, but the ones we setup will be backed by KMD. the oracles use the DTO, which is specific to komodod chains

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: https://medium.com/@jameslee777/decentralized-trustless-oracles-dto-by-piggybacking-on-timestamp-consensus-rules-2adce34d67b6

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: we also have aggregated oracles, which are not as secure but can still be useful if designed properly for cases where chain value exceeds whatever value the oracle affects

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and also cases where just having the data available from a specific pubkey is enough

Author: Enkh D#1827
Content: @jl777c Thanks. What do you think will be the differentiating usecase for komodo in the years to come? Do you  think atomic dex will still be the main focus for the near future?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: atomicDEX is just one of many aspects

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it is the focus now as it is needed by other parts of the system

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: once it is in place and working stable at scale, then we wont need to spend so much manhours on it, yet it will be a very important part of the overall picture, especially with all the regulation that will hit the CEX and fake DEX projects

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: not sure if you are talking about usecase for KMD or for komodo tech

Author: Enkh D#1827
Content: I feel like kmd tokens have not found its true utility after all these amazing developments. Barterdex never caught on - And I am just worried that what if atomic dex does not also attract many users as well.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: https://medium.com/@jameslee777/tokenomics-are-for-tokens-not-for-coins-3f262d0aa4b3

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: since we dont like taxation schemes it must be the usage of KMD that comes indirectly from all the projects that use it creates. by having the ONLY no-tax platform, projects that care about costs have a strong incentive to use komodo

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: creating an end user product is a lot of work and is very expensive, we do not have the resources to make all the different end user projects that could be built with komodo tech.

Author: Enkh D#1827
Content: Also why is the komodo team so perfectionist in terms of being decentralized? Do you not think you could have launched decentralized poker sooner  maybe if you could trade off some decentralization?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: CHIPS is not being done by the komodo team

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: as slow as the development has been, are there any other actually decentralized poker projects yet? even with millions of funds raised, they all seem to basically be centralized

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and what is the point of doing it, if it is centralized

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: CHIPS is basically a community project and has done quite well considering that

Author: Enkh D#1827
Content: You are right I dont think there is any project that actually came up with the poker game that is ready to play.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: they are very close to having a working GUI using the decentralized logic

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but yes, if the entire komodo team focused on CHIPS, then it certainly would have been done sooner, but then it would be the CHIPS team at that point, which it isnt.

Author: Mark81#4505
Content: Komodo is focusing to create technology to projects that need it freely to build on it and are able to focus their own business front. It firstly very big thing that komodo team doesnt need to seek funding to keep developing. Business that want to utilize blockchain technology first should put that also on their radar.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: we make reference implementations for most things. with atomicDEX, it is a critical part of the overall system, so we made it ourselves

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: for most other projects, they are certainly nice to have, but really we are not in the business of being in business. lets businesses make end user products and make their money

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: as a mostly horizontal tech provider, we need to provide tech without competing with projects that use our tech

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: maybe this isnt the optimal approach you will say. but to build out all areas would take many millions of dollars, which we never raised, so not an option

Author: Enkh D#1827
Content: Yup! I really respect your focus and dedication to the project.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: there are projects that raised hundeds of millions and then make some centralized "solution", which are not so hard to make and not so expensive to make. so they have a lot of funds available for marketing

Author: Enkh D#1827
Content: You are definitely right. I also feel like ethereum has so much momentum that Komodo did not get the attention it deserved

Author: Mark81#4505
Content: Komodo needs only its name recognized and its framework to be known.

Author: Enkh D#1827
Content: Komodo is absolutely better project than all the shitty projects that raised millions of dollars in 2017, but Komodo has always been better than them. Its just pity that komodo never received much attention like eos and cardano did even though komodo tech is better and has been ready to use for years.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it has held up quite well considering the onslaught of new projects onto CMC, other projects from around the same time, many are far from the top 50

Author: Enkh D#1827
Content: I think I will read the oracle piece and head to bed - Its good to know that you still are active and answer community questions like you did in slack a year ago. Merry Christmas!

Content: Satoshi writed in his white paper that bitcoin as in protocol first implemention is money. After that how many new  api calls has implemented to bitcoin to support various business needs or are those there to support only its use case as money?
